text.section:
The county executives of Montgomery County and Prince George's County shall submit to the respective county council:
on or before March 15 of each year, the proposed capital and operating budgets, including:
recommendations on the proposed capital and operating budgets; and
the record of any public hearing on the capital or operating budget held by the Commission; and
any amendments to the proposed capital and operating budgets with the county executive's recommendations within 10 days after receipt of the amendments.

section.section: If the county councils fail to concur in a change with respect to any item in the capital or operating budget on or before June 1 of each year, the failure to concur constitutes approval of the item as submitted by the Commission.
If the county councils fail to approve the capital and operating budgets on or before June 1 of each year, the proposed capital and operating budgets of the Commission are deemed approved.
The Commission may submit detailed proposed supplements to the approved capital and operating budgets to the county executives of Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
Within 10 days after receipt of a proposed budget supplement, each county executive shall submit the proposed budget supplement, including recommendations, to the respective county council.

Each county council:
may hold public hearings on the proposed budget supplement; and
may add to, delete from, increase, or decrease the proposed budget supplement.

The failure of the county councils to jointly approve or amend the proposed budget supplement within 90 days after the date that the Commission submits the proposed budget supplement to the county executives constitutes disapproval of the supplement as submitted by the Commission.

On submission of the approved capital and operating budgets the county councils of Montgomery County and Prince George's County may jointly recommend to the Commission rates for:
water service charges;
sewer usage charges; and
ad valorem taxes.
On receipt of the capital and operating budgets and recommendations from the county councils, the Commission shall approve a rate schedule.
In approving a rate schedule the Commission shall consider the proposed rate changes jointly recommended by the county councils.
Subject to § 25-101 of this article, the rates for water service charges and sewer usage charges shall be uniform throughout the sanitary district.
